newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR QUOTED WEAKER ON IMPORT PRESSURE.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR QUOTED WEAKER ON IMPORT PRESSURE.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar held steady on the mark but was quoted softer against other hard currencies on the back of slight import pressure on Friday morning, dealers said.

"There was an order for about $5.3 million this morning and the local dollar has depreciated slightly. But it's a small panic though and things should return to normal sometime in the afternoon," a dealer said.

He and others however re-iterated that a strike by junior doctors and nurses to press for better salaries and working conditions, now going for its fourth week, had not affected the foreign exchange market.
At around 0755 GMT the local unit was trading at 10.6500/6700 against the U.S. dollar, down from the 10.6400/6600 perch it had occupied for the past four days.

It also fell to 17.7700/7900 from 17.7100/7300 against pound sterling, tracking an easier U.S. dollar overseas and was at 2.2700/2900 from Thursday's 2.2600/2800 against South Africa's rand. Against the mark however, it was quoted unchanged at 7.0600/0800. -- Stella Mapenzauswa, Harare Newsroom: +263-4 72 52 28/9
